intro: Galipea jasminiflora, commonly known as the jasmine tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that resemble jasmine, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly glossy appearance. The flowers bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
